item.title: 安桥输油管道称威斯康星州漏油清理工作正在进行中
item.description: Enbridge 公司周六表示，11 月 11 日在威斯康星州泄漏的 960 桶石油中的 60% 已被清理，受影响的土壤正在被清除。【原文：Enbridge Inc. said Saturday that 60% of the 960 barrels of oil that were spilled on Nov. 11 in Wisconsin has been cleaned up and any affected soil is being removed.】

item.title: 智利人无法承受地球的热量
item.description: 觉得您最喜欢的辣菜少了点辣味？极端天气使辣椒的火辣程度降低，厨师们不得不在厨房里随机应变。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享今天的头条新闻。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Feel like your favorite spicy dish is missing some heat? Extreme weather is making chilis less fiery, and chefs are being forced to improvise in the kitchen. You can read and and share a version of today’s lead story on Bloomberg.com. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 如何购买别人可能真的想要的二手礼物
item.description:
为了追求独特性和物美价廉，购物者越来越愿意购买和接受二手礼品，而且这样做对地球更有益。【原文：

In search of uniqueness and affordable quality, shoppers are increasingly open to buying and receiving secondhand gifts — and it’s better for the planet.

】

item.title: WEC Energy 为可再生能源项目提供 25 亿美元美国贷款
item.description: 拜登政府正在为 WEC 能源集团公司在威斯康星州的子公司提供多达 25 亿美元的融资，用于建设可再生能源和电池储能项目。【原文：The Biden administration is offering WEC Energy Group Inc.’s Wisconsin subsidiary as much as $2.5 billion in financing for the construction of renewable power and battery storage projects.】

item.title: 加州汽车排放案获美国最高法院复审
item.description: 美国最高法院将审理一起因加利福尼亚州车辆污染限制引发的冲突，并同意裁决生产或销售生物燃料的公司是否有合法权利就该法规提起诉讼。【原文：The US Supreme Court will hear a clash stemming from California’s vehicle pollution limits, agreeing to decide whether companies that produce or sell biofuels have a legal right to sue over the regulations.】

item.title: 众议院小组称发现 "气候卡特尔 "勾结的证据
item.description: 众议院司法委员会称，它发现了 "大量证据表明 "金融业存在 "串通和反竞争行为"，对美国公司 "强加激进的环境、社会和公司治理目标"。【原文：The House Judiciary Committee said it’s found “substantial evidence of collusion and anticompetitive behavior” by the financial industry to “impose radical ESG-goals” on US companies.】

item.title: 快速移动的暴风雪将在北加州降下 70 英寸的积雪
item.description: 本周末，一场快速移动的风暴将席卷加利福尼亚州北部和西北太平洋地区，给该地区带来大风、暴雪和洪水。【原文：A fast-moving storm will sweep into northern California and the Pacific Northwest this weekend, bringing high winds, heavy snow and flooding rain to the region.】

item.title: 强烈气旋 "奇多 "瞄准莫桑比克北海岸
item.description: 法国气象局称，热带气旋 "琪朵 "在向印度洋马约特岛袭来的途中加剧了风力，风速高达每小时 260 公里（160 英里）。【原文：Tropical Cyclone Chido intensified as it barreled toward the Indian Ocean island of Mayotte on its way toward Mozambique’s northern coastline, the French meteorological service said, with wind gusts of up to 260 kilometers (160 miles) per hour.】

item.title: 德国哈贝克对提前淘汰煤炭计划表示怀疑
item.description: 德国经济部长罗伯特-哈贝克（Robert Habeck）对该国提前淘汰燃煤发电的计划提出了进一步的质疑。【原文：German Economy Minister Robert Habeck raised further doubts over the country’s plans for an early phase-out of coal-fired power generation.】

item.title: 拜登 4000 亿美元绿色银行为特朗普做好准备
item.description: 距离当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的就职典礼还有不到一个月的时间，能源部正在敲定清洁技术贷款。今天的时事通讯将关注谁将获得贷款，以及特朗普如何重塑能源部。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享本篇报道的完整版。如需无限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：With President-elect Donald Trump’s inauguration less than a month away, the Energy Department is getting clean tech loans finalized. Today’s newsletter looks at who’s getting loans — and how Trump can remake the office. You can read and share a full version of this story on Bloomberg.com. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 美国立法者再次推动阻止假冒熟油的流通
item.description: 美国立法者正在加大对环境保护局的压力，以阻止可能损害美国大豆种植者的疑似假冒外国废食用油的流动。【原文：US lawmakers are ratcheting up pressure on the Environmental Protection Agency to stem the flow of suspected fake foreign used cooking oil that could be undermining American soybean farmers.】

item.title: 特朗普上台在即，拜登的绿色银行着手完成数十亿美元的交易
item.description:
能源部的贷款项目是拜登留下的气候遗产的重要组成部分，但在1月份之后，该项目前途未卜。【原文：

The Energy Department’s lending program is a key part of Biden’s climate legacy, but its future is uncertain after January.

】

item.title: 随着世界变暖，辣椒的热度也在下降
item.description:
极端天气使人喜爱的香料变得不那么火辣。厨师们并不高兴。【原文：

Extreme weather is making the beloved spice less fiery. And chefs aren’t happy. 

】

item.title: 鱼类的地狱"：美国斥资十亿美元阻止鲤鱼入侵
item.description:
官员们正在对中西部水道进行武器化，以防止该地区的渔业受到破坏。【原文：

Officials are weaponizing Midwest waterways to prevent a disruption of the region’s fishing industry.

】

item.title: 澳大利亚反对党公布耗资 2110 亿澳元的核电计划
item.description: 澳大利亚的主要反对派提出了一项耗资 3310 亿澳元（约合 2110 亿美元）的计划，要在短短十多年内建立一个由纳税人出资的核能产业，尽管该国的顶级科学家们表示，风能和太阳能等可再生能源更具成本效益。【原文：Australia’s main opposition group laid out a A$331 billion ($211 billion) plan to create a taxpayer-funded nuclear power industry in just over a decade, despite the nation’s top scientists saying renewable energy such as wind and solar energy is more cost effective.】

item.title: 英国旨在启动 2400 亿英镑的绿色电力闪电战以减少天然气消耗
item.description: 英国计划改革电网规划和连接规则，希望在 2030 年前每年刺激约 400 亿英镑的投资，以努力消除化石燃料发电。【原文：The UK plans to reform rules on planning and connecting to its power grid in hopes of spurring some £40 billion of investment a year through 2030 to try and eliminate fossil fuels from electricity generation.】

item.title: 如果特朗普发动贸易战，加拿大考虑对铀和石油征收出口税
item.description: 如果即将上任的美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁征收广泛的关税，加拿大正在研究对出口到美国的主要商品征收出口税，其中包括铀、石油和钾肥。【原文：Canada is examining the use of export taxes on major commodities it exports to the US — including uranium, oil and potash — if incoming President Donald Trump carries out his threat to impose broad tariffs.】

item.title: 帝国公司希望为价值 110 亿美元的油砂碳项目获得更多援助
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp. ）旗下的加拿大油砂开采部门帝国石油有限公司（Imperial Oil Ltd. ）呼吁政府为该行业提供更多资金。【原文：Imperial Oil Ltd., the Canadian oil sands unit of Exxon Mobil Corp., is calling for more government funding for the nation’s industry, which is embarking on a C$16 billion ($11 billion) endeavor to deploy carbon capture and storage technology and slash emissions by 2030.】

item.title: 研究发现：气候变化 "增压 "了菲律宾的台风季节
item.description: 一项新的研究表明，气候变暖助长了今年在几周内袭击菲律宾的六场强风暴。【原文：A warming climate fueled the blitz of six powerful storms that hit the Philippines within a matter of weeks this year, according to a new study.】

item.title: 野火肆虐，马里布居民越来越依赖高价保险
item.description:
所谓的非认可保单有助于填补房屋保险的缺口。但是，它们的成本很高，只有富人才能负担得起。【原文：

So-called non-admitted policies are helping fill home insurance gaps. But they come at a steep cost only the wealthy can likely afford.

】

item.title: GE Vernova 预计陷入困境的海上风电行业将面临更多麻烦
item.description: 通用电气弗诺瓦公司（GE Vernova Inc.【原文：GE Vernova Inc., the maker of the biggest offshore wind turbines in the Western hemisphere, sees grim prospects for a beleaguered industry that’s facing slowing demand and weak pricing.】

item.title: 为干旱买了保险，但仍在挨饿
item.description: 今天的时事通讯关注参数保险，一些非洲国家正在购买这种保险来帮助灾后恢复。问题是，它并不总能赔付。【原文：Today’s newsletter focuses on parametric insurance, which some African countries are buying to help with disaster recovery. The problem is it doesn’t always pay out.】

item.title: 气候技术基金投资放缓，现金堆增至 860 亿美元
item.description:
布鲁克菲尔德（Brookfield）和TPG等重量级金融企业今年又募集了新的气候基金，在投资减少的情况下为未来提供了积极的信号。【原文：

Financial heavyweights like Brookfield and TPG have raised new climate funds this year, offering a positive sign for the future even as investments are down.

】

item.title: 看清气候技术炒作的本质并寻求利润
item.description:
"氢气是能源领域的瑞士军刀，"突破能源风险投资公司的埃里克-托恩（Eric Toone）在《零点》杂志上说。它 "完全彻底地改变了游戏规则"

。【原文：

“Hydrogen is the Swiss Army knife of energy,” Eric Toone of Breakthrough Energy Ventures says on Zero. It’s a “complete and total game changer.”

】

item.title: 风力减弱有助于消防员灭火，马里布大火蔓延速度放缓
item.description: 加利福尼亚州的消防员似乎正在控制一场野火，这场野火一直威胁着海滨城市马里布，因为煽起大火的干燥风力开始减弱。【原文：Firefighters in California appear to be reining in a wildfire that has been threatening the coastal city of Malibu as the dry winds that fanned the blaze begin to ease.】

item.title: 一所大学如何抵御马里布的毁灭性野火
item.description:
佩珀代因大学的消防安全计划为在气候变化加剧野火的情况下保护生命和财产安全提供了一个模板。【原文：

Pepperdine University’s fire safety plan provides a template for protecting lives and property as climate change worsens wildfires.

】

item.title: 谷歌和约翰-杜尔押注利用碎石捕集二氧化碳的初创公司
item.description:
科技界的重量级人物正在对一种未经证实的技术下注，以直接从空气中清除气候污染。【原文：

The tech heavyweights are placing a major bet on an unproven technique to pull climate pollution directly from the air. 

】

item.title: 厄瓜多尔亚马逊债务转换将取消 15 亿美元债券
item.description: 厄瓜多尔离完成第二次债转股又近了一步，该国现有的超过 15 亿美元的美元债券有望被取消。【原文：Ecuador is moving one step closer to complete its second debt-for-nature swap with more than $1.5 billion of the nation’s existing dollar bonds on track to be canceled.】

item.title: 德国取消 3.5 亿欧元氢能项目补贴
item.description: 德国放弃了向氢能项目投入 3.5 亿欧元（3.68 亿美元）的计划，这使得清洁燃料目标更加遥不可及。【原文：Germany abandoned plans to funnel €350 million ($368 million) into hydrogen projects, putting clean-fuel goals even further from reach.】

item.title: 气候援助不足，非洲转向不稳定的保险形式
item.description:
非洲国家正在购买参数保险，以帮助灾后恢复。但它并不总能赔付— 而且它不能替代富裕世界的气候补偿。【原文：

African countries are buying parametric coverage to help with disaster recovery. But it doesn’t always pay out — and it’s no substitute for climate compensation from the rich world.

】
